intro: Cavendishia micrantha, commonly known as the small-flowered Cavendishia, is a flowering plant native to South America, particularly Brazil. It belongs to the Bromeliaceae family and is characterized by its rosette-shaped leaves that form a water-holding cup. The plant produces small, clustered flowers that are typically white or pale pink, adding to its ornamental value. It thrives in humid, shaded environments and is often found in tropical rainforests. Due to its unique appearance and ecological role, it is of interest to botanists and horticulturists alike.
